name: Banshee
description: Incorporeal female spirits that linger after death in order to cause suffering to the living. Haunt desolate moors.
special_abilities:
▶ Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
▶ Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
▶ Energy immunity: Unharmed by cold-based or electrical attacks.
▶ Wail: All within 30' must save versus death or die. Usable once per day and only during the hours of darkness.
▶ Origin: Legends say that banshees are the spirits of wicked female elves.

name: Thoul
description: A horrific hybrid of hobgoblin and ghoul. Hunts at night and ambushes sleeping prey. The party was attacked by one when they didn't set a watch — Beiric killed it with a critical strike, tearing its head off with his spear.
special_abilities:
▶ Paralysis: Successful claw attack requires Save vs Paralysis or be paralyzed for 2d4 turns.
▶ Regeneration: Regains 1 HP per round. Cannot regenerate fire or acid damage.
▶ Ambush: Thoul gains surprise on 1-4 (d6) when attacking sleeping prey.

name: Funeral Choir Mourner
description: Pallbearers of the Land of the Dead. They carry coffins through fog-shrouded roads lit by green-flamed lanterns, chanting the names of the 'Chosen Souls of the Ascension.' They have stitched mouths and hollow eyes. They bow and vanish into the mist when refused.
special_abilities:
▶ Name Chanting: Know the true names of souls they carry. Speaking a name aloud causes the target to Save vs Spells or feel compelled to follow.
▶ Vanish: Can dissolve into mist at will.
▶ Undead: Immune to sleep, charm, and mind-affecting spells.
▶ Servants of the Choir: They serve the Three-Note ritual of Azelach.

name: Lantern-Bearer
description: Pumpkin-masked spirits that emerge from fog, speaking in riddles and circling campfires. When Enmog taunted them — 'Do you want to fucking go?' — they laughed and answered, 'We already went.' Battle erupted. Their laughter turned to shrieks when Beiric ignited them with oil. The mist itself caught flame.
attacks: 1 × lantern slam (1d8 fire) or 1 × riddle curse
special_abilities:
▶ Fire Vulnerability: Take double damage from fire. Oil + flame causes explosion (2d6 to all within 10').
▶ Riddle Curse: Instead of attacking, may ask a riddle. Wrong answer causes 1d4 WIS damage.
▶ Mist Walk: Can teleport up to 30' through fog or mist.
▶ Death Laugh: When reduced to 0 HP, shrieks cause all within 20' to Save vs Spells or be frightened for 1 round.

name: Giant Leech
description: Blood-sucking horrors found in swamps and barrows. Two attacked the party in the Great Barrow Mound, knocking both Beiric and Ninuel unconscious. Thirlirgwe rescued them.
special_abilities:
▶ Blood Drain: After successful bite, automatically drains 1d6 HP per round until killed or removed.
▶ Detach: Requires a successful STR check or fire/salt to remove.
▶ Swamp Camouflage: Surprise on 1-3 in swamp/water.

name: Reedwalker
description: Fae creatures that serve the Hag of Hag's Addle. They have reed-masked faces and small hoof-like feet. They stole the ceremonial poniard from the Stump & Poniard tavern and brought it to the Hag's Hut. Tekwell Onehorn says: 'They've a mind like magpies… but what they take ain't never random.'
special_abilities:
▶ Magpie Thieves: Drawn to steal specific objects of cultural or emotional significance. Never steal coin — always meaningful items.
▶ Entangle: Instead of attacking, can cause marsh reeds to grapple a target. Save vs Paralysis or immobilized for 1 round.
▶ Swamp Blend: Surprise on 1-4 in swamp/marsh terrain.
▶ Servants of the Hag: Report directly to the Hag. Items they steal are brought to her for ritual corruption.
▶ Reed Mask: If the mask is removed, the Reedwalker dissolves into plant matter.
